item.title: Down Hatherley manorial
item.description: Down Hatherley is a rural parish to the west of Cheltenham
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Leckhampton
item.description: This parish, to the south of Cheltenham, will form part of Volume 15 of VCH Gloucestershire.
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Wormington Probate Inventories, 1679-1753
item.description: This set of 12 probate inventories, now kept at Gloucestershire Archives, has been transcribed by an Archives volunteer, and will contribute to a future voloume of VCH Gloucestershire. Only three occupations are explictly stated - two yeomen and one carpenter.
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Meysey Hampton probate inventories, 1682-1796
item.description: This set of 26 inventories, now at Gloucestershire Archives, has been transcribed by an Archives volunteer as part of preparation for a future volume of VCH Gloucestershire. Where an occupation is stated, 'yeoman' predominates. There are also one carpenter, one joiner and one victualler.
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Swindon Village probate inventories, 1711-1729
item.description: Five inventories survive at Gloucestershire Archives for the small parish of Swindon (to the west of Cheltenham), and have been transcribed by an Archives volunteer. Among them are the inventories of two yeomen and one thatcher.
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Hundred Roll
item.description: The Hundred Roll for Cheltenham was not included when the series was published in the early 19th century. Although researchers have consulted and quoted from the surviving membrane, it has not previously been fully transcribed.
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Cheltenham medieval wills
item.description:
Very few medieval wills are known for Cheltenham. Four survive in the PROB11 series at the National Archives, and will be added here as transcription proceeds.

Another 6 copy wills survive at Worcestershire RO. They have been trancribed from microfilm, with the loss of occasional words towards the edge of the image.

Pious bequests are a marked feature of these pre-Reformation wills, and give clues as the contemporary arrangement of the parish church in Cheltenham.
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Cheltenham: medieval manorial rentals
item.description:
Included here are transcriptions of several rentals mostly of the 15th century, held at the National Archives (SC 11/216 to 227). Most of them can be linked to the period when the manor was owned by the Abbess of Syon, Middlesex.  They are probably best described as stray survivors rather than as a set (several are damaged or incomplete), and there is no obvious logic to the cataloguing order. Only 3 pieces have internal dates, but by comparison of tenants' names, and other clues, a relative chronology can be established.  Transcriptions were done by members of the Cheltenham Local History Society's Latin Group, working from images taken by Dr Beth Hartland, who is researching medieval Cheltenham (and Cirencester) for the Victoria County History of Gloucestershire.  A further related item, a survey of c1440, has been transcribed from D855/M68, held at Gloucestershire Archives.

The likely sequence is:

11/220 - C14th?

11/221 - 1420?

11/218 - 1430 (dated)

11/225 - 1430?

11/222 and 223 - 1440?

11/217 - 1450 (dated)

11/219 - 1450 and 1452 (dated)

11/216 - 1470

11/227 - late Elizabethan
item.dc:creator: JamesH

item.title: Blockley Probate Inventories
item.description: Blockley was formerly in Worcestershire, and only one inventory is held at Gloucestershire Archives. It has been transcribed by a member of the Archives staff, in support of ongoing work on the Victoria County History of Gloucestershire.
item.dc:creator: JamesH
